docs.lead_paragraph: Deaths from infections more than doubled from 1997 to 2007, mainly because of the bacterium C. difficile and norovirus.

headline.seo: Gut Infections Are Growing Much More Lethal
headline.main: Gut Infections Are Growing More Lethal
headline.print_headline: Gut Infections Are Growing More Lethal

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that gastrointestinal infections are responsible for increasing number of deaths in the United States and have become a particular threat to the elderly; leading cause of infection is the Clostridium difficile bacterium, which spreads more easily in patients taking antibiotics, but researchers also found a large number of deaths from the highly contagious norovirus.
docs.snippet: Deaths from infections more than doubled from 1997 to 2007, mainly because of the bacterium C. difficile and norovirus.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Unexplained stomach pain besets a young man.
docs.abstract: Lisa Sanders Diagnosis column describes a man with unusual symptoms who was ultimately diagnosed with acute intermittent porphyria, a disease that results from problems in making an essential component of red blood cells.
docs.snippet: Unexplained stomach pain besets a young man.

docs.lead_paragraph: The National Children’s Oral Health Foundation and the American Society of Dentist Anesthesiologists respond to a front-page article.

headline.main: Preventing and Treating Dental Disease in Children
headline.print_headline: Preventing and Treating Dental Disease in Children

docs.lead_paragraph: Some new parents are going to extreme lengths to protect their children from household toxins. But how far is too far?

headline.seo: Going to Extreme Lengths to Purge Household Toxins
headline.main: Is It Safe to Play Yet?
headline.print_headline: Is It Safe To Play Yet?

docs.abstract: Some hyper-vigilant new parents are going to extreme lengths to protect their children from household toxins; suggestions for resources that help identify toxic chemicals in the home noted.
docs.snippet: Some new parents are going to extreme lengths to protect their children from household toxins. But how far is too far?
